page.title: 03PLANT LIFE ON LINKS & DUNES
page.content: Many plants grow behind newly built-up dunes where they are protected from salt water and wind.Examples are HARE'S FOOT CLOVER,PURPLE MILK VETCH and the rare BLUE FLEABANE which only grows on one other site in Scotland. The links, though mowed, also contain many plants. The minute CURVED SEDGE, only recently discovered, is so small that it is untouched when the fairways are mowed. In wet hollows of the links,there are patches of BALTIC RUSH,and in acid sandy soil HEATHER thrives.(The 6th Hole of the Old Course is called "Heathery" for this reason).GORSE or WHIN form patches of scrub around the courses, with striking yellow "pea" flowers in early summer. The other large bush growing along the edge of the links is the TREE LUPIN with its sweet- scented, pale yellow flowers.
